headline.main: Parental Quandary Considered: Choosing a Child's Guardians

docs.abstract: Choosing the legal guardian for your child in the event of your death is the right thing to do. I still haven't done it.
docs.snippet: Choosing the legal guardian for your child in the event of your death is the right thing to do. I still haven't done it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Here is the commentariat's most prevailing thought on choosing your child's guardian when there's no obvious solution: blood is thicker than, well, anything else.

headline.main: What's at Stake in Friday's Jobs Report
headline.print_headline: Stagnant Job Growth Is Expected In Report

docs.abstract: The economic pie is growing, but the share going to American workers is at an all-time low. Friday’s jobs report will help determine whether American workers will finally start getting a bigger cut.
docs.snippet: The economic pie is growing, but the share going to American workers is at an all-time low. Friday’s jobs report will help determine whether American workers will finally start getting a bigger cut.

docs.lead_paragraph: 7:57 p.m. | Updated The economic pie is growing, but the share going to American workers is at a record low. Friday's jobs report is expected to show that Americans are not on their way to getting a bigger cut.

headline.main: What's at Stake in Friday's Jobs Report

docs.abstract: The economic pie is growing, but the share going to American workers is at an all-time low. Friday's jobs report will help determine whether American workers will finally start getting a bigger cut.
docs.snippet: The economic pie is growing, but the share going to American workers is at an all-time low. Friday's jobs report will help determine whether American workers will finally start getting a bigger cut.

headline.main: Drug Makers Dial Down TV Advertising

docs.abstract: Pharmaceutical companies have cut spending on television advertising by 20 percent over the last five years, according to a Nielsen study. Analysts expect drug advertising to continue to fall as more brand-name drugs face generic competition.
docs.snippet: Pharmaceutical companies have cut spending on television advertising by 20 percent over the last five years, according to a Nielsen study. Analysts expect drug advertising to continue to fall as more brand-name drugs face generic competition.

docs.lead_paragraph: Spending on the advertising of brand-name prescription drugs on television  -- which not long ago was a fast-growing marketing venue for the pharmaceutical industry in the United States -- has dropped more than 20 percent in the last five years.

headline.main: Drug Makers Dial Down TV Advertising

docs.abstract: Pharmaceutical companies have cut spending on television advertising by 20 percent over the last five years, according to a Nielsen study. Analysts expect drug advertising to continue to fall as more brand-name drugs face generic competition.
docs.snippet: Pharmaceutical companies have cut spending on television advertising by 20 percent over the last five years, according to a Nielsen study. Analysts expect drug advertising to continue to fall as more brand-name drugs face generic competition.

docs.abstract: Just because you can come up with a theoretical justification for a policy doesn't make it a good idea.
docs.snippet: Just because you can come up with a theoretical justification for a policy doesn't make it a good idea.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since writing Sunday's column, I've read a lot of defenses of the Obama White House's decision to force religious institutions to cover contraception, sterilization and the morning-after pill, and this post from Kevin Drum captures the gist of nearly all of them:
docs.abstract: Just because you can come up with a theoretical justification for a policy doesn't make it a good idea.
docs.snippet: Just because you can come up with a theoretical justification for a policy doesn't make it a good idea.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cetusa, a sponsor of a State Department work/travel program, was reviewed after 400 participants staged a walkout at a Hershey packing plant.

headline.seo: Company Banned by State Department in Effort to Protect Foreign Students
headline.main: Company Banned in Effort to Protect Foreign Students From Exploitation
headline.print_headline: Company Banned in Effort to Protect Foreign Students From Exploitation

docs.abstract: State Department bans prominent Council for Educational Travel, USA, from bringing foreign students to the United States for summer jobs; hopes to send message to dozens of private companies participating in the work program that they will have to monitor foreign students far more closely to ensure that they are not being exploited as cheap workers; move follows incident in which 400 foreign students walked out of abusive jobs they had been assigned to at a Hershey's plant.
docs.snippet: Cetusa, a sponsor of a State Department work/travel program, was reviewed after 400 participants staged a walkout at a Hershey packing plant.
